channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole, 17th June
item.description:
I twisted my ankle whilst running on this deep pothole by the side of the road. Repair please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 Large Derp Potholes, 17th June
item.description:
There are 3 potholes that you cannot avoid because the road is single track. If you are running or on a bike it is a dangerous hazard. They are getting bigger and potentially damage your car because you canâ€™t dodge them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The t junction is full of potholes, especially at the sides. If you are on a bike it is not safe and not good for your car

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone

item.title: Cars blocking bus stop, 15th June
item.description:
Cats parked in bus stop all day , buses have to load from middle of road. Safety issue and disability issues.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large trees becoming a problem, 15th June
item.description:
These trees on this section Gloucester road have become far too large. They are now suffering from an aphid problem that is causing massive amounts of honey dew that is causing damage to property and vehicles. In 6 years maintainance has only been done once - and this was just to remove other plants growing within the tree itself.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 283 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water logged area, 15th June
item.description:
There is a patch of path that is very muddy and waterlogged (has been very dry and warm lately) and it seems to be coming from further up the little hill. Behind the first fence there is evidence of water on the fences beyond, could be a water leak?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 St. Lawrence Court Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on pavement, 15th June
item.description:
The property opposite keeps parking on the pavement, even if my car is parked legally on my side of road, my car L123dah shown was parked with nothing else parked opposite, but the tenants opposite have now parked on pavement reducing road width for buses and emergency vehicles, also the kerb opposite was lowered and the grass verge removed to allow vehicles to pass anything parked without the need for them to mount the grass verge opposite

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Rookery Road, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping near a Wales and West utility, 14th June
item.description:
Mattress, etc., have been here for at least two months and reported to Wales and West as well as to CBC (case no. DSFX1653224184836). Just wondering when it is scheduled to be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lypiatt House Lypiatt Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrow footpath, 14th June
item.description:
The public footpath from Brockhampton lane in Swindon Village heading left to the back of home Farm known as Broad Green is really overgrown and unusable as a public footpath. The same is on the other side from Brockhampton lane to the back of the playing fields towards the railway line. Please arrange for the the public footpath / bridleway to be cleared to allow access. I have checked with Home Farm owner (Margaret Bick) who advise that this is land owned and managed by Cheltenham Borough council, although it has not been maintained by CBC for a while. Many Local residents have complained about this to our Parish Council. Thank You.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Crossing Cottage Brockhampton Lane, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 James Smith Row Barbridge Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown hedges on pavement and walkway., 13th June
item.description:
Pavement by Town Cars on Cheltenham Road East and walkway in the same area towards Snowdon Gardens hedge is so overgrown you have to walk on the busy road walking to and from the bus stop. Also the grass on walkway towards Snowdon Gardens. You have a duty of care for everyone using the pavements,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 65-77 Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Swallow Crescent, Innsworth
